thread.title: Apple finally kills off 16GB iPhone SE, now you get 32GB for $399
thread.title_full: Apple finally kills off 16GB iPhone SE, now you get 32GB for $399

author: Natasha Lomas
title: Apple finally kills off 16GB iPhone SE, now you get 32GB for $399
text:
Apple finally kills off 16GB iPhone SE, now you get 32GB for $399 Posted Mode Media Japan lives on, with founder Samir Arora as chairman 
Rejoicer lovers of petite-sized iPhones, for Apple is granting additional storage bounty — announcing today it’s doubling the current storage capacity of the iPhone SE. 
The new four-inch display iPhone comes with either 32GB or 128GB on board storage, replacing the prior 16GB and 64GB models — but with only a small price-tag bump for the more capacious model (+ $50, to $499), and no price change for the $399 starter model. 
As with all iOS devices there’s no ability for users to expand storage capacity themselves via a removable memory card of their own. You get what you’re given — so being given more is very welcome. 
Cupertino launched the iPhone SE a year ago , reviving the four-inch display design it debuted on the iPhone 5, back in 2012 — throwing a bone to lovers of smaller phones. Yet not throwing in a whole lot of storage. 
Indeed, Apple has been criticized for continuing to sell a handset with just 16GB of on board storage in an age of smartphone-powered rich media sharing. And, well, it finally looks to have listened — keeping the $399 starter price for the cheapest iPhone SE but doubling the storage. 0
